docs.lead_paragraph: Two days after giving birth in the summer of 2014, Reanne Pederson left a hospital with her baby boy Avery and a prescription for 20 hydrocodone pills to treat pain.

docs.lead_paragraph: Brayden Cummings turned 6 weeks old the morning his mother suffocated him.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Congress adopted the Keeping Children and Families Safe Act in 2003, the intent – spelled out in the law – was to ensure protection for drug-dependent newborns, not to punish mothers battling addiction.

docs.lead_paragraph: It grew faster than the economy in 2014, the government said, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect.

headline.main: Health Spending in U.S. Topped $3 Trillion Last Year
headline.print_headline: Health Spending in U.S. Topped $3 Trillion Last Year

docs.abstract: Health and Human Services Dept reports health care spending in United States has risen to more than $3 trillion, due in part to expansion of Medicaid and private health insurance coverage under Affordable Care Act, along with continued sharp increase in cost of prescription drugs.
docs.snippet: It grew faster than the economy in 2014, the government said, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: On a frigid evening on the outskirts of Moscow, two HIV-prevention activists unzip backpacks, pull out packs of hypodermic needles and start discretely approaching people leaving a nearby pharmacy with an offer that could save their lives.

headline.main: Russia HIV Infection Bucks Trends as World Aids Day Marked
headline.print_headline: Russia HIV Infection Bucks Trends as World Aids Day Marked
